characters: FLICKERS, GOES OUT AND DROPS TO THE CAVERN FLOOR. SMASH
ON TWO BOXTROLLS, SPARKY AND SNIPS, GATHERING A FEW BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning strikes, illuminating a vine covered wall as th camera moves across a dark alley filled with CARDBOARD BO and CRATES. They boxes have stylized LABELS; the box in front is labeled FOCUS FEATURES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: FOOTSTEPS running on cobblestones and LABORED BREATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not my boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning strikes again, highlighting the boxes and rubbi in the alley. Something is coming. Whatever it is, its breath is hurried and animalistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: A BABY CRIES out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stumpy CLAWED FEET wrapped in rag run past a boxed labele LAIKA. The camera follows the shadowed figure as it runs along cobblestones to the end of the lane. The creature pauses under an arched entryway and turns, revealing GLOW EYES, a large mouth full of wonky teeth, and a BABY SHAPE BUNDLE in its arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTING CRASHES as the BABY wriggles and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A FIST pounds a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake his lordship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: A SERIES OF LOCKS being unlatched on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUTLER opens the double doors, frowns. He starts to clo the doors but Snatcher pushes against the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unspeakable has happened. (GASP) We must speak of it immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice calls out from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Snatcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The butler moves aside, revealing a regal man with a whit hat at the top of an ornate marble staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORD PORTLEY-RIND looks on from the mezzanine. The man in the red hat casts a long shadow across the gleaming check floors of the Cheese Guild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxtroll monsters have stolen a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Lord Portley-Rind, perfectly groomed and perfec horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: ARCHIBALD SNATCHER in the door, backlit by streetlights, sheets of rain falling behind him. He's a b man, but out of shape (all belly and no butt), with long shreds of greasy hair sprouting from beneath his crooked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're no doubt picking their teeth with his adorable baby bones by now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrible tragedy. (beat, flippant) Let's deal with it in the morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Butler closes the door, but Snatcher shoves his foot the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, oof! That's not the worst of it! Next they'll come after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Butler shoves at the door, slapping and shoving Snatcher's face until the door slams shut. Snatcher opens mail slot and yells through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...OUR CHEESES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Gouda!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll stop at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind suddenly flings open the doors, stares wide at Snatcher. He is crouched on the ground near the mail slot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the town exterminator. I'll pay whatever it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher stands slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't want money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps into the house and into the light, REVEALING his greedy face for the first time. He smiles an oily smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want one of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher points to the WHITE HAT on Portley-Rind's head. Portley-Rind grabs his hat protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A White Hat? You?! Absurd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher turns to leave, moving towards the damp Market Square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then. But prepare to say bye bye to your Brie. Cheerio to your Cheddar. Goodbye to your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind's resolve disappears. He raises his hand as to stop Snatcher from leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Every boxtroll gone. With proof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher stops halfway down the stairs in the pouring rai his back still turned to Portley-Rind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a white hat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Snatcher's grinning face as he turns back towar Portley-Rind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will destroy every last boxtroll in this town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING CRASHES as Snatcher laughs maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE VIEW OF CHEESEBRIDGE, a steep hill-town that looms o the countryside. A jumble of roofs, a tangle of twisting alleys, and perched at the summit, the imposing Cheese Gu Hall. The last rays of the setting sun disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a deep voice echoes out of a scratchy MEGAPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear ye! Hear ye! Good citizens of Cheesebridge, the curfew is in force. Don't dawdle or the beasts will tear you limb from limb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A FABRIC BANNER reading "BOXTROLL EXTERMINATORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banner hangs on a strange rattletrap TRUCK that winds way up the city streets. Sinister looking men in BLOOD RE TOP HATS hang onto the running boards. The most sinister them all, Snatcher, rides on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will add your flesh to their rivers of blood and mountains of bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the truck passes, PEDESTRIANS gasp and hurry into thei houses, heeding the amplified warning. A CHEESEMONGER at Cheesery pulls his FOLDING SIGN from the sidewalk and hur inside. A COUPLE stops mid-conversation and heads indoors MAN CARRYING A CRATE brings his load into his shop, abandoning the crate sitting at the curb. Two FEMALE TOWNSFOLK head off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Archibald Snatcher as the truck rounds a corner He holds a MEGAPHONE TUBE to his mouth and orates as he z in on a BOY playing ball in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child! Do you want to end up like the Trubshaw Baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy watches the truck as it passes, curiosity changin horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragged underground and feasted upon one year ago this very night?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrified boy shakes his head and GASPS as he is yank inside by his MOTHER. His BALL bounces out of his hands a rolls across the cobbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock your windows! Bolt your doors! Hide anything that is not bolted down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man grabs his DOOR KNOCKER and bolts inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another man grabs his MAILBOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another a BARBER POLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a terrified look the last man peers out of the peep in his door, then slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide your cheese. Hide your tender and delicious babies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind blows trash down the empty streets. Snatcher's vehicle, rattling from its boiler, prowls past with Snatc still calling out his warning until the sound fades in th distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beware the bloodthirsty monsters! They'll fry your eyes, gnaw on your knees, gobble your gizzards... Beware! BEWARE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Snatcher's truck has passed the CAMERA lands on: A MANHOLE. Carved in the heavy iron cover is a warning: "HE BE MONSTERS".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG BEAT OF SILENCE. The manhole cover slowly twists a lifts, a pudgy blue hand emerges. Two pairs of yellow, glowing eyes peer out. The creatures talk in expressive b unintelligible GURGLES. Down the street, two more manhole covers lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In pairs and in gangs, these BOXTROLLS -- so called for t cardboard boxes they wear -- emerge from the sewers and scurry through the streets of the besieged town. Their lo forboding SHADOWS creep across walls plastered with poste that read: "CHEESEBRIDGE: A GOUDA PLACE TO LIVE", "REDHAT BOXTROLL EXTERMINATORS".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch them scurry through streets and alleyways, gurgl quiet directions to each other. They move swiftly and tra in packs. We see a lone boxtroll jump and pull himself in his box as a DOG BARKS. He pops back out of his box and m along quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: what appears to be a LARGE BOXTROLL MONSTER pee around the corner of a moonlight street. Its glowing eyes turn toward the camera as it sways slowly. Five more pair eyes light up within the large, boxy shadow and SIX BOXTR separate from the mass, popping off to run their errands while the coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRDS EYE VIEW: Groups of two and three boxtrolls snake t way down streets, skirting carefully around areas lit by street lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a small lane, groups of boxtrolls stop to collect mechanical stuff. They work together, using their boxes a tools and props.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIX BOXTROLLS stack up in the background to steal a SHOP SIGN, while THREE BOXTROLLS cooperatively steal the WHEEL from a WOODEN CART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One boxtroll uses his box to prop up a       corner while two release the wheel from the axle. A       LONE BOXTROL the frame to see what treasures he may       find in a tr as he knocks it over with a CLANG, TWO       BOXTROLLS sc and stack together, stealing the HOUSE       NUMBER from of a brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: the boxtrolls' booty - the shiny brass number ` the shop sign for `TIMELESS TIMEPIECES', the wheel that r along between two boxtrolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six other boxtrolls on the hunt stack together against a fence. We watch as one boxtroll makes it over the top, cooperatively pulling the others into the alley behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The inside of a trash can as the lid is removed Two BOXTROLL HANDS wriggle into view over the rubbish, fi of NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS, an APPLE CORE, a BANANA PEEL, and FISH CARCASS. The boxtroll gurgles "EWW" and "BLECH" soun as he moves these unwanted items aside. He gurgles with j when a bit of brass is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FISH, a nervous 4-foot tall, wonky-toothed, pointy-eared, gangly-limbed boxtroll, pulls an old broken ALARM CLOCK f the trash barrel. He is in a large alley, filled with old boxes, crates, broken items and tarps strewn about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish stares curiously at the object, turning it over in h hands and holding it to his ear, listening. He shakes the clock and hears loose gears RATTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish opens the clock face        and gurgles, intently to the mechanical interior.         After a moment, the cloc TICK with activity. Fish         gurgles excitedly and cl clock face, holding it to        his ear to listen to the ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GURGLES) Oh yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish's eyes go wide as the clock's alarm RINGS, attractin the attention of an uglier, 2-foot-2 boxtroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fish stands proudly admiring the sound of his ringing alarm clock, SHOE bounces around his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GURGLES) Gimme that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe, short and feisty, grabs the alarm clock from Fish a scampers away with it. Fish watches as Shoe climbs a stac crates and hisses back at him, sniffing at his new prize. Fish scowls at Shoe and returns to the rubbish pile, shak his head and muttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him a half-dozen boxtrolls methodically pick throu an assortment of trash barrels and old boxes. It's like a troop of monkeys at the dump. They find mechanical stuff, inspect it, and then either drop it into their box to kee toss it back into the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A filthy TEDDY BEAR WITH A MUSICAL KEY is discarded by another boxtroll, landing with a THUNK and A FEW TINNY MUSICAL NOTES. Fish turns excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the teddy bear and cranks a key in its back a Shoe toys with the stolen alarm clock. The teddy bear pla MUSIC. Fish gurgles along to the tune and bobs his head, enjoying the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Shoe notices Fish has found something interesting. shoves the alarm clock into his box, stealthily sneaks up Fish and makes a grab for the teddy bear! Fish refuses to go and they squabble over it. Suddenly all the boxtrolls to attention, their ears alert--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creepy RATTLING SOUNDS of the Redhats' truck returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the boxtrolls hide in their boxes. The "camouflage" works. Their boxes fit in perfectly with the trash barrel and packing crates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rattling comes closer... closer... then STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! HEADLIGHTS light up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men dismount from the truck and cast long shadows across the alley and all of the boxes: the giant MR. TROU the beanpole thin MR. PICKLES, and the short, pit bull MR GRISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boxtrolls don't run -- they just KEEP HIDING IN THEIR BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENTLEMEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher spreads his arms theatrically and wades into the garbage-strewn alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all these boxes left lying about. How curious, how peculiar. I do believe... evil is afoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gristle chuckles and breaks into a psychotic grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAHAHA. FOOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish peeks out of his box momentarily, then retreats when sees the Redhats advancing into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Trout and Mr. Pickles absentmindedly check boxes for boxtrolls, but Mr. Gristle methodically stomps and smashe every box he can. When he finds a box with a boxtroll, he uses a CRICKET BAT to WHACK it back to the others to load onto the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever seen someone's foot be evil, Mr. Trout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the boss meant evil is nearby, Mr. Pickles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My foot had a pretty nasty bunion once. I wouldn't say the foot itself was evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just a fancy-man's word for vicinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrinkly ol' bunion looked like my grandmum. Had to saw her off. The bunion, not my grandmum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gristle spots a shivering box and positions himself o it, cricket bat in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes.   FOOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Gristle kicks the box, and it flies toward Mr. Pic and Mr. Trout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pickles scoops it up in a dog catcher's net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, ya squirmy monster. Your days of evil-doin' are over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gristle finds another shivering box. He swings his ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! A box slides over to Trout. A dizzy boxtroll pops for a moment, groaning. Trout taps its head and the boxtr retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think these boxtrolls understand the duality of good and evil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must, right? Why else would they hide from us. We are the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pickles strolls off with both boxtroll and net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting more boxes) Nice! NICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Another box slides over to Trout. Trout scoops up box before the creature can get away. The boxtroll's legs dangle below as it is carried away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I suppose we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Fish and Shoe, in the shadows at the edge of th alley, gurgle to each other while the Red Hats are distracted. Their heads stay hidden in their boxes as the waddle slowly out of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gristle is too preoccupied with smashing other boxes notice them. He grunts and laughs with the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher spots Fish and Shoe as they exit the alley and points at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GRISTLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACQUIRE THEM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandishing his cricket bat, Gristle springs after Fish a Shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acquire! ACQUIRE! HAHAHA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boxtrolls pop out of their boxes and RUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gristle closes in on them as they sprint down an alley. T boxtrolls join hands and vault over a fence like a Slinky toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gristle smashes THROUGH the fence--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME BACK AND LET ME HIT YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but the boxtrolls have disappeared. Gristle stalks down street and disappears around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Gristle disappears, two boxes that are holding up a broken street cart suddenly move. It's Fish and Shoe hidi in plain sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they are sure they are not being followed they open drainage pipe and slip underground into the sewers--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (0300 UDW) UNDERWORLD Eggs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where they leap into cardboard-lined BOXTROLL CHUTES. drop through the chutes, sliding on the cardboard, until join up with other boxtrolls returning from a night of gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend deeper underground until they are collected together in a funnel-shaped cave and one by one drop onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- elaborate conveyor belt system for a roller coaster ri into a HUGE DARK SPACE with blinking lights and a cacopho of MECHANICAL NOISE. Fish, Shoe and boxtrolls of all shap and sizes shoot off the end of the conveyor belt and tumb across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FISH AND SHOE where the alarm clock lands on the floor they tumble to a halt. Shoe grabs the clock possessively, hisses at Fish, and runs away laughing. He has his treasu Fish shrugs it off and rights himself, raising a hand to mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eggs?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL THE CAVERN, the hub of the boxtroll world. It's fu of workshops, interconnected machines and a constellation lights that make it look like a subterranean Coney Island amusement park. Fish stands in front of a large STALAGMIT around which the mechanical underground city is built.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eggs?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHEELS - a boxtroll riding a unicycle - zooms quickly pas humming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You see Eggs?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheels shrugs his shoulders and rides away as OIL CAN - t smallest boxtroll - tumbles from the conveyor belt and ri himself with a squeak. Oil Can pulls, well, an OIL CAN fr inside of his box and scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish makes his way to the base of a waterwheel made from scraps of metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High overhead, the boxtroll KNICKERS - a picture of underpants adorning the front of it's box - struggles wit armful of light bulbs while swinging from a rope. Two sma boxtrolls hold the rope steady below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY, a boxtroll wearing welding goggles, and a small boxtroll named BUCKET work side by side on an electrical generator, fitting dinner forks into a toaster as makeshi fuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eggs?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky and Bucket look up from their work and give Fish directions to find Eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gurgled in unison) "Over there!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Oil Can climbs down a pipe to grease u the generator and then scrambles back up the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish heads off as Sparky and Bucket turn on the toaster a get ZAPPED! They jerk and squirm as electricity courses through their boxes and they collapse on the ground. The strands of light bulbs flicker and light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky and Bucket smile and beat their boxes in delight - they fixed the generator. The two boxtrolls holding the r let go and beat their boxes. Knickers falls to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHH!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish arrives at a SUBTERRANEAN GARDEN where boxtrolls sit among huge cabbages eating ladybugs and slugs. Fish stops front of FRAGILE, a giant, slow moving, dim-witted boxtro Fragile slowly mists a seedling plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eggs?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fragile just stares at Fish until Fish gets frustrated an leaves. Fragile slowly points, in the direction opposite Fish's path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A BOXTROLL'S REAR END. He scratches the backside of hi box and - WHOOSH! - is sucked up into the air, revealing Fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish steps up to a huge PNEUMATIC TUBE driven by a dozen antique vacuum cleaners and calls up to SWEETS, a toothle boxtroll with a set of old human dentures in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eggs?!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweets stops, thinks, gets an idea and starts to speak ju as SPECS, a myopic boxtroll with an elaborate head gear o eye glasses, twists an ANCHOR switch, turning on the pneumatic tubes. First his DENTURES, then Sweets, are suc up into the tube. Fish watches Sweets go and then sees Oi Can standing on top of the tubes oiling stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "EGGS?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil Can stops oiling the tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He's up there!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil Can points up at a small cave high on the cavern wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish arrives at the opening of the small dark cave. In th shadows of the nook is a shape. It appears to be a very s boxtroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, feral growls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the shadows waddles the small boxtroll. The first thing that comes into the light is his box with an EGGS L printed on the front, then appears the dirty face of a fe looking 2-YEAR-OLD HUMAN BOY, EGGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish flashes a wonky-toothed smile at Eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish plays a game of hide and seek with the found teddy b He makes the arm, then another arm, then the head appear the arm and head holes of his box. Baby Eggs is enthralle He excitedly launches himself at Fish. They play wrestle the toy until Eggs grabs it from Fish and scampers away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs hugs the bear. So cute. Then... RIPS ITS HEAD OFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into the teddy bear's chest cavity and pulls o the MUSIC BOX. He tosses the gutted bear body away and tr to get it to work. When he can't figure it out he holds i up to Fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish winds the music box, gurgling an explanation of how works. Music fills the dark nook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs giggles with delight as the gears work again.    The close their eyes and hum along to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do do doo do doo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hums along with music)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop humming when the giant clock chimes signaling t end of the boxtroll "day".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: the clock as the large hands representing the m and the sun flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the lights go out, Knickers and the other boxtrolls ga at the center of the cavern to sleep in a big, communal s of boxes like one big family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeping pile is stacked tight and high. Fish and Egg climb to the top of the pile. Fish holds Eggs up so he ca pull a chain to turn out the last light in the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Eggs lies   looking straight up. The ceiling of the is dotted with   lots of small lights and slowly turning machines -- it   looks like the flickering of stars. Baby happily drifts   off to sleep, snuggling the head he ripp from the teddy   bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boxtroll clock chimes, signaling it is night above gr and time to wake up! Eggs swings from the light bulb and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The box pile explodes and falls apart as all the boxtroll are startled awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - EGGS NOOK: Fish winds up the teddy bear's MUSIC BOX and adds it to a MUSIC MACHINE, built out of assorted junk an driven by the teddy bear's music box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs pounds a hammer on a typewriter at the bottom of the machine and Fish pulls out a saw and draws a bow across i Together they play a croaking music-mechanique song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Eggs rides on WHEELS' shoulders. Wheels makes gurgling sounds like he is revving his engines. They ride around t base of the CONVEYOR BELT, watching boxtrolls roll down f the CHUTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheels swerves to avoid boxtrolls as they tumble off of t conveyor belt, holding Eggs out to Fish as he rolls into view. Fish catches Eggs and runs with him held like a football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Fish in the cavern nook. He pulls out a prize bit of ju a 78 rpm album by the QUATTRO SABATINO. Eggs' eyes go wid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OOOH! Hee hee hee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish puts the record on the player and lowers the needle. Baby Eggs holds on to the record player, shaking his bott to the beat and dancing, while Fish plays a MUSICAL SAW w his BOW. Eggs dances and turns to Fish, beating his box approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CLOSE ON: A roiling pile of BUGS as boxtroll hands, and baby human's hand, reach in and grab fists full of bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxtrolls munch up mouthfuls of bugs and Eggs chomps away with them, just another monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Eggs and Fish play music in the nook, their music machi is evolving. First Eggs shakes the jar of buttons, then h strikes a beat on a cowbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Eggs is chasing Oil Can. He trips on his box and falls on his face, popping out of his box by mistake. Oil Can s Eggs empty box and FREAKS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil Can's wailing gets all the boxtrolls in the cavern to turn, see the empty box and SCREAM! It's a collective communal melt down - Fish runs up to Eggs in a panic, cra his box back on and GURGLES the rule-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOXTROLLS NEVER TAKE OFF THEIR BOXES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Baby Eggs and Fish continue to play their music in the nook. Eggs hit the cowbell expertly with a spoon and danc smiling and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - 11 YEAR OLD EGGS laughing absolutely rocking out to the music machine with the Quattro Sabatino song mixed in. Eg plays the WASHBOARD while Fish plays his saw. The jar of buttons and the cowbell have been added to the music mach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Close on several PILL BUGS crawling on the cavern floor Shoe pokes them and they curl into a ball. He gathers the up and growls happily from behind a pile of junk, eyeing Eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs hides behind a little barrier of corrugated metal wi his own pile of pill bug balls. Shoe hurls a bug at Eggs misses, hitting the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Missed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs tosses a bug at Shoe, and Shoe smugly laughs as the flies into a tube. While he laughs, the bug shoots out fr the tube, smacking him on his nose. OOF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Eggs and Fish are grooving along to their music machine Eggs transitions from the washboard to smashing light bul with a SKILLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside of the nook, other boxtrolls bob their heads happ along with the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CLOSE ON: Eggs as he slides on a "new" HELMET made out junk. It is fitted with lights so he can see in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT. Eggs stands beneath the pneumatic tubes as the boxtrolls gather around him. Specs throws the switch and Eggs is sucked up the tubes, the boxtrolls beat their box in excitement. Shoe unceremoniously steps into the tube w the others celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The shadowy shapes of Fish, then Shoe, then a super exc Eggs spring out of a manhole and scamper into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon after, Shoe finds an umbrella, Fish holds up a buste wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs finds his first real "treasure" in an alleyway - a broken EGG BEATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Wheels zooms towards us carrying a MAIL BOX. Eggs pushe Shoe in a wheelbarrow as Fish runs along, all cheering wi their loot. Suddenly BLAM! Wheels is hit by a BOLAS! Eggs leaps into a barrel and the others hide as the Redhats cl down from their truck and carry Wheels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA HAAA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another villain off the streets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs starts to move, to go after Wheels.   Fish holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting, quietly) Wheels!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Fish holds his arm) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs stares after his friend and slowly slips down to hid a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Like monsters from a child's nightmare the Redhats loom of the darkness, smash boxes and collect boxtrolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The boxtroll sleeping pile dwindles as more and more boxtrolls are kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Another night of scavenging as a garden gate hinge SQUE Eggs and Fish continue running but Oil Can can't help him - he stops to oil the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil Can doesn't realize Gristle is standing right behind aiming a medieval looking BLUNDERBUSS BOLAS GUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! He fires point blank, capturing Oil Can. The little boxtroll's oil can flies down the street and lands in fro of Eggs' hiding spot. Eggs WHIMPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - SLEEPING PILE: The significantly smaller community tuck for the night as the now rusty water wheel squeaks in the background. Eggs looks forlorn and holds Oil Can's oil ca Fish GURGLES reassuringly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fish slips into his box to sleep, Eggs SIGHS and looks at the greatly reduced number of "stars" (light bulbs) in ceiling. The water wheel squeaks constantly in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs scampers through thick fog across a large Market Squ encircled by regal buildings. At the far end stands the impressive CHEESE GUILD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish and Shoe lag behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe runs face first into a STREET LAMP - BOOM! - sending gears and baubles clattering to the cobbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe! Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs and the boxtrolls' silhouettes skitter across the square, over to a small side alley. There is a LOUD CLANG Eggs and the boxtrolls run into a trash barrel, sending t trash can lid noisily rolling across the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP the Cheese Guild... a LIGHT COMES ON IN A WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE WINDOW, peeking from behind an ornate curtain, a y girl watches the trash can lid fall over and wobble to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl, WINNIE (12, red-hair, nightgown) GASPS wi fear -- and fascination -- then whips the curtains closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxtrolls! (SHUDDER) They could come eat my face off at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better warn father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie runs down a staircase towards a set of double door The SOUND of LAUGHTER and WAFFLING VOICES grows as Winnie approaches the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie knocks gently. No response. She knocks harder. Sti no response. She impetuously pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Victorian MAN CAVE. A dark, ornate rotunda with wa lined with cases of RARE CHEESES. At a table stacked with FINE CHEESES, four men are seated, wearing gleaming WHITE HATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOULANGER, an old man in a STEAM-POWERED WHEEL CHAIR, sno at one end of the table while the short, rotund LANGSDALE tall, thin, beak-nosed BRODERICK roar with laughter at th other end. Standing imperiously in the middle, and wearin the most ornate white hat, is LORD PORTLEY-RIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle down, men, settle down. Important town business to discuss. First on the docket: more complaints of crumbling bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of crumbling... is that a new blue cheese I see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broderick stands and leans into the cheese, breathing dee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does smell delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we could do with a nibble first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They taste cheeses like snobs tasting fine wines -- sniff rolling it on their tongues, spitting in buckets, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm... Pungent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tasting notes of... plum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boulanger snores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full, reading

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All good fun, but we do have this school funding initiative to vote on. Been sitting here for months. All in favor of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Cutting open the Roquefort next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AYE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Portley-Rind tosses the docket behind him, giving in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay, okay. A quick reminder, tomorrow is Trubshaw Baby Remembrance Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we all know what that means... a performance by Madame Frou Frou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of STEAM shoots out of Boulanger's wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VISION!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... With some cheese on her bones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind leans in like he has a secret, and slowly caresses a piece of brie as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lady like that is like a fine brie. Raw. Dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a little stinky, but one taste and you'll be begging for... mmm . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Portley-Rind nuzzles the brie and kisses its crust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he looks up he sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINIFRED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SQUEEZES the cheese in his hand, which EXPLODES all ov A hunk of the brie lands on his hat. He jumps up and stor over to the door. The White hats murmur and gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winifred go on. Off to bed. Off to bed! Come on, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Father! I saw boxtrolls again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoo. Shoo. Shoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind's eyes keep sliding back toward the room beh him, where the others are tasting another fine cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right outside. They could come rip the flesh off my bones any moment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them: LOUD grunts of satisfied tasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would be a shame to miss this, Portley-Rind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes one moment! (to Winnie, distracted) Winifred, proper girls should not be obsessing over grotesque monsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind's attention is directed to the shenanigans g on behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not obsessed! I just can't stop imagining them gnawing off my toes and stringing them together as a necklace! Father? Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind turns back and pats Winnie on the head like is a little dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they kidnapped me and slurped up my intestines like noodles, would you give up your white hat to save me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still not listening) Hmm? Um. Yes, Winifred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Uh... White Hat? Right. (looks at his hat) What.. Oh, seems to have been smudged by a bit of brie. Be a dear and have the butler give it a wash, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands a stunned Winnie his White Hat and turns her tow the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door on her before she can finish her thoug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now gentlemen, I apologize... sorry! Back to important White Hat business... Pass the Camembert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie is hurt and frustrated. She looks down at the Whit Hat in her hands. Her eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give your hat a wash all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High on the front of the Guild, Winnie bursts through a s of french doors and onto a balcony holding the white hat, face an angry scowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses Lord Portley-Rind's hat, frisbee style, out in the night sky. The hat glows in the moonlight as it sails across the Market Square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white hat hits the ground in the middle of the square

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, satisfied, dusts her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, her smile slowly melts as she realizes this was not brightest move. She hears raucous laughter from the Tasti Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DOOR as Winnie quickly unbolts the locks and cra the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie cautiously peeks out of the Guild. The light behin her casts a long strip across the empty Market Square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist swells in the small pools of light from streets ligh The rest is swathed in dark shadows. The hat is clear acr the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steeling herself, Winnie creeps out and down the stairs, fancy satin slippers are silent. She gets to the bottom o the stairs and looks around. Nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white hat looms from a distance.   She gasps, realizi how far she has to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She creeps forward a few more steps and hears a noise. Sh hears something skittering along out in the fog and makes terrified SQUEAK. She covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who... who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shape steps forward from the darkness of a nearby alley but is obscured by mist. Two little lights cut through th vapor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie scrunches her face slightly, focusing intently on figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape creeps a little closer. A hunched-over silhouet with glowing round eyes. It's a boxtroll monster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie gasps. She stays put and turns her head to the sid screwing up her face with curiosity as the figure stands upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure takes another step towards her. REVEAL it is E He lifts his goggles. The light from the street lamp reve his face. He is guarded but curious and mimics Winnie's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gasps in wonder, the hat momentarily forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish and Shoe suddenly grab him from behind and pull him of Market Square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fish and Shoe) Why would she call me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, BRIGHT LIGHTS hit them! It's the REDHATS' TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs and the boxtrolls sprint around the square, chased b the Redhats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right there, Mr. Trout!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH WINNIE as she watches Eggs and the boxtrolls sprint of the square just a few steps a head of the Redhat's tru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're right behind you. HA hahaha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie stares, slack-jawed as the truck's lights disappea down the hill, then she turns and reaches for her father' hat, but it's gone, instead she sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a big shadowy figure holding the hat and staring at it lustily -- Archibald Snatcher. Winnie GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Someone's out past curfew. Very dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie is speechless for a moment, then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I saw a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher still stares at the hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I saw was filthy boxtroll monsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher finally looks at Winnie with an oily, false smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Portley-Rind. Allow me to escort you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher leans down and offers his arm to Winnie. She snu him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can escort myself, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie turns her back to Snatcher and he gives a grunt of frustration and restraint. She turns back to collect the hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll just give me my father's hat back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie grabs for the hat. Snatcher swishes it out of her reach and heads for the stairs into the Guild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, how did this hat find itself aaaaall the way out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... wind! Blew it, right out the window. Very windy tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher looks doubtful. He licks his finger and holds it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Must've died down. Suddenly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher heads right to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but as a gentleman, I insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher shoves open the doors, pushes his way into the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and approaches the foot of the main stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Portley-Rind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the TASTING ROOM DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX Muffled voices of White Hats enjoying themselves sudd stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie winces. She turns to Snatcher who is admiring the white hat again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have the hat back now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher puts the hat behind his back, grins and pulls Wi up the stairs by her wrist, toward the Tasting Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind bursts out to see Snatcher ascending the sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in Gouda's name is going on? Archibald Snatcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deepest apologies, your Lordship. But I found something out in the street that belongs to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher gestures behind him revealing a sheepish Winnie. he turns he also reveals the white hat. Portley-Rind rush down the stairs to meet Snatcher half way and GRABS THE H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My White Hat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Portley-Rind pulls on the hat, Snatcher refuses to let go, so they tug each other up and down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that... Now, now, Snatcher one doesn't acquire a white hat by simply--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --picking it up... off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind finally wins the tussle and grabs the hat ba He growls under his breath at the smudges left on the bri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white hat indicates privilege, prestige, position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be earned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes a handkerchief from his breast pocket and dabs the hat's brim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the top of the stairs the other Guild members chime

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Valor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chivalry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or being rich! That's how I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher looks up at them and bows, removing his red hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't I know it, sirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher climbs the stairs and gets face to face with Por Rind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, we still have our little... agreeeeement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind grimaces, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um.. ehhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher opens his arms, gesturing widely, as he recites particulars of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I destroy every last boxtroll in this town, I shall earn my white hat... and join you in the Tasting Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher takes a step toward the Tasting Room door and lo longingly into its warm, inviting interior. The White Hat reach back and slam the doors shut. Snatcher's face falls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good lord. (twists his mustache) Not sure who should be more terrified - the boxtrolls or us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Hats chuckle. Snatcher's expression drops into scowl. Portley-Rind puts his hat back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, how the devil did my hat get outside in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher smirks and gestures toward Winnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told the wind had something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind looks at Winnie and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I'm sorry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! Can't stay. Too much work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Portley-Rind, your Lordship, Sirs. I bid you good night. I'm sure we'll be seeing each other again very, very soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher oozes out the door. Portley-Rind looks at Winnie shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm.. Winnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie is about to defend herself when Snatcher pops his back in and points to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget. I'm a size six-and-a- half. Order ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he finally leaves, his hat gets caught in the door and lets out a frustrated growl/groan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie pleads her case from the foot of the stair case as White Hats return to their cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I'm sorry! I didn't mean to. Well, at first I did, but I think this situation offers a great opportunity for a father and daughter to discuss their feelings--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind rolls his eyes and turns back to the Tasting Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --WAIT! I saw something out there. A boy with boxtrolls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Father I really-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind shuts the door leaving Winnie alone. She loo back towards the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did see a boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Fish, Eggs and Shoe sprinting down a twisting a turning street. The Redhats' vehicle is right behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs' helmet is blown off while he runs. It flies onto th street behind them and is crushed under the Redhats' truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hark! Here come The Exterminators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exterminate! HA ha ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't that sound like we're the villains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: ON TWO BOXTROLLS, SPARKY AND SNIPS, GATHERING A FEW BLOCK
dialogues.text: AHEAD: BAM! They are hit by headlights as Fish, Eggs and come running between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky and Snips hide in their boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hark! Here come The Exterminators... OF JUSTICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE EXTERMINATE JUSTICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pickles and Mr. Trout look at each, both terrified of Gristle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab hold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs, Fish and Shoe join hands and leap from the streets rooftops. As they careen from roof to roof, the boxtrolls tuck into their boxes, but Eggs can't fit in his box. He wraps his arms around Fish's box and rides on Shoe's box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redhats' vehicle skids around the bend and swerves through the streets until it gets below them. Gristle's h sticks out, wind whipping his face like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA HA HA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there Mr. Trout!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pickles nervously aims a BOLAS GUN, clearly not comfortab with the weapon. He fires, and a WEIGHTED BOLAS shoots ou but, misses Eggs and the boxtrolls badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs, Fish, and Shoe tumble off of the rooftops. They fal through the air before bouncing from a store AWNING and landing on the cobblestone street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs leads the boxtrolls toward a drain pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gristle FIRES his sawed off BOLAS GUN as the truck skids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn! HA HA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bolas whizzes toward Eggs and the fleeing boxtrolls a they leap into a drain pipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FISH as a the weighted bolas wrap around his box. His feet are pulled out from under him as he reaches out towa his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bolas rope is attached to the Redhats truck, just out of the sewer pipe. The rope tightens as they begin to win up the slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs and Shoe turn to see Fish grabbing the sides of the slick sewer, trying not to be pulled away. Eggs scrambles around Shoe, hiding in his box, and rushes to Fish as he dragged down the pipe towards the Redhats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs grabs Fish's hand, but the Redhats are too strong. F frantically cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs! Eggs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs can't hold on and Fish's hand slips free, he's pulle out of the pipe CRYING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EGGGGS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish is yanked out of sight.   Eggs is left lying on the ground, gasping ffor breath.   His best friend is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs startles as Shoe touches his shoulder. He looks up a Shoe shakes his head, resigned. Shoe takes Eggs' arm and slowly leads him deeper into the pipe bend, toward home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the spinning Quattro Sabatinos record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs sits hunched over in despair with one finger resting the music machine, causing it to play very, very, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Eggs we see Shoe's face appear. He stares at Eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe throws a bug at Eggs. It bounces off his head. No reaction, so Shoe does it again... still no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe enters the nook. Eggs looks at him. Shoe holds out t hands full of yummy bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gurgles) Bugs for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe sighs, and puts a bug in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we do this, Shoe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe stops eating, opens his mouth as if to answer then pauses, agape. The bug crawls out and up onto the top of head. Shoe thinks, gurgling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry on like everything is normal? They drag us away and we do nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lucky bug extends it's wings and flies away. Shoe doe react. He doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe glances out of the cave as the remaining boxtrolls s to make what's left of the communal sleeping pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoe looks back and forth between Eggs and the sleeping p He knows he should stay, but the sleeping pile is really coming together out there. With a whine of frustration fo his friend, he shakes off some bugs for Eggs to eat and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs sighs and looks over to the corner where Fish's old and bow lean against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bugs Shoe left crawl up Eggs' arm and he angrily shov them away and notices the Quattro Sabatino's RECORD COVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The faces of the four singers, each one festoon with an elaborate mustache, and then on to their orange a brown striped coats and finally focussing on their straw boater hats. Eggs lowers it to reveal--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Eggs REFLECTION IN AN OLD CRACKED MIRROR. He is wearing disguise based on the singers from the Quattro Sabatino's record cover (which he holds in his hand). He has made a striped jacket by sewing strips of orange fabric to an ol coat and found a filthy old straw boater. He has even dra twirled Van Dyck mustache on his face with a lump of coal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look like one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SIGH) Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the pile of sleeping boxtrolls as they snore. looks back at the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find you, Fish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tiptoes out into the cavern and sneaks off into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a pitch black sewer, a thin ray of sunlight shoots dow from a hole in a manhole cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs' filthy hand, wrapped in torn strips of fabric, reac into the light. Dust motes drift around his hand and glow The reflected light illuminates Eggs' wide eyed face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN SHOT: Eggs climbs up toward the manhole. He has to squint at the bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EGGS POV: Looking up at the manhole until the bright ligh fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: As we go into the light, the sound of the streets of bustling city gets louder and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A heavy cast iron manhole as it grinds open. Blinding sunlight pours in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs' dirty face peeks out. His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLANG! A fat man steps on the manhole cover and slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. The manhole opens again (KLANG!!), and again is slammed shut as it is driven over, by a CART that stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs shoves the manhole open and clambers out. For a seco he's reassured at how calm it is then the cart moves off he is left crouching in the middle of a busy street. He l up and is BLINDED BY THE SUN. AAARGH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRUM BEATS and a CYMBAL CRASH! Eggs jumps out of the way ONE MAN BAND marches through, almost running him over. He pushed and shoved by a festive crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outta the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until he backs into an OLD TIMEY BACKDROP painted with lu images of monstrous boxtrolls stealing a wailing baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yer picture taken with the Trubshaw Baby! A humorous keepsake for this dark and dreadful day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHH!! (rights himself) Eek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs stumbles backwards into the crowd where he is crushe between pedestrians until he is lifted off the ground and carried along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ehh! Oof. Eek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above Eggs the bright sun distorts the faces in the crowd like in a fever dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs is carried along, his feet lifted off of the ground the bustling crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Oww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd parts and he is dropped to the ground at the fo of a stage with a loud OOF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone hushes as a too enthusiastic CARNIVAL BARKER'S v introduces the act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gents, From the long- lost land of Crackerslovakia -- MADAME FROU FROU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADAME FROU FROU bursts through the curtains. She's a big sexy, voluptuous woman, exotic in a weird Eastern Europea MAE WEST kind of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helloooo Cheesebridge! Hello darlinks! Thank you! Thank you! My darlinks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoo hoo! I'm your biggest fan, Frou Frou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portley-Rind and the White Hats call from their exclusive podium in the center of the crowd. Winnie and a very bore Lady Cynthia Portley-Rind stand next to Lord Portley-Rind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Portley-Rind, you are TOO much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe just enough! Rowrr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frou Frou gives him a wink as Lady Portley-Rind elbows hi the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oof. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frou Frou takes center stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today I shall perform ze sad tale of ze Trubshaw baby! But first, I need a helper from ze audience!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie jumps up and down, waving her hand enthusiasticall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises hand, jumps) Me! Pick me! Me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending not to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone? Anyone at all? Nobody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'd like to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie roughly elbows the boy out of the way--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move aside! Pick me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and climbs up on stage without being asked. Eggs is transfixed - It IS the girl from last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Little Miss Portley-Rind, you shall play ze sweet little baby Trubshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frou Frou gives Winnie a bonnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a boy with boxtrolls last night! Maybe your audience would like to hear-- OOF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frou Frou shoves a pacifier in Winnie's mouth and scoots behind the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick to ze script, my darlink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frou Frou walks to the BARREL ORGAN and turns the BRASS HANDLE. Once it is wound, she takes her place at center stage, a FAN poised coyly over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years ago a plot was hatched Where evil was with cunning matched Whoever left their doors unlatched Would find their infant children

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON EGGS watching the show, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oo    no   Boxtrolls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie and Mr. Pickles, without his red hat and wearing a fake mustache, come dancing out on stage as Papa Trubshaw Baby Trubshaw. Pickles struggles to pick up Winnie and ho her like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trubshaw Senior loved his kid The same as regular father's did If you don't want to share his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure that you are locked up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie dances in place and pretends to sleep as Pickles w off stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this night Baby's Dad Trubshaw Quite forgot to lock his door And as soon as he began to snore The Boxtrolls came in to withdraw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those vile Boxtrolls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trap door opens in the stage floor and Mr. Gristle clim out dressed in a crude BOXTROLL COSTUME made from papier- mch. Gristle GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So lock your windows, bolt your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Boxtrolls with their creepy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will take your children in their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And drag them down to feed their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd HISSES as Gristle grabs Winnie and pushes her d the trap! Gristle makes CHOMPING and NOM NOM sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAWR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pickles runs onto the stage melodramatically pantomiming heart-broken father searching for his missing child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Trubshaw went quite wild When he found out he'd lost his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did what any Dad would do He ran off swiftly to pursue those

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gristle returns and stalks Pickles from behind--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! / Behind you!/ Look out man! He's behind you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And, a bit too enthusiastically, shoves Pickles down through trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Help, help, help me please won't you?" But the Boxtrolls did what

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They snatched him up and began to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until there was no residue Of Trubshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Trout throws an arm full of papier-mch BONES onto stage. Gristle picks one up, shoves it into his papier-m jaws and taunts the audience like a villainous profession wrestler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pulled him down into their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly pausing to digest They left his bones but ate the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never be a dinner guest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oo those Boxtrolls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man standing next to Eggs overhears and looks down at h Eggs pales and pulls his disguise tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the story of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do what Father Trubshaw did If you see Boxtrolls don't placate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch 'em and exterminate them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frou Frou wallops Gristle with her fan. The crowd cheers on as she beats the crap out of him in a not-very-ladylik fashion. The crowd is whipped into a frenzy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill those Boxtrolls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs is crushed by the furious crowd as they chant along Madame Frou Frou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill those Boxtrolls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill those boxtrolls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget about our party tonight, Frou Frou!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs looks around at the frantic crowd, he sees Winnie exiting out the back of the stage. She dusts herself off heads back into the crowded market. Eggs follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Winnie makes her way across the crowded square Eggs follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - When he sees the One Man Band coming closer, he ducks d into a box shape as if he could hide like a real boxtroll When the danger is passed he looks up and sees Winnie disappearing into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Eggs runs to catch up and has to jump over a vendor pus a cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? What the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Eggs falls in behind Winnie a she nonchalantly circles tent of a cheese seller. She suddenly looks back and STAR RIGHT AT EGGS! Eggs hides behind a Swiss cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie ignores him and heads off down the street with Egg still following until she--

dialogues.speaker: EXT MARKET SQUARE
dialogues.text: --Lunges around a corner and disappears! Eggs runs after turns the corner and she's gone. Suddenly she jumps out i front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs, startled, instinctively hides in a barrel. Winnie p in at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the worst pickpocket I have ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses him a coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, buy yourself a book on how to be a better thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs climbs up out of the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I saw you last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie freezes, eyes wide. She slowly turns back to him. looks down, too scared to look her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they took Fish, and... I don't know where they took him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and Winnie is right in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were with the boxtrolls last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs wipes the coal dust mustache from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah! I KNEW IT! I KNEW IT! I KNEW IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie gleefully dances about as Eggs climbs out of the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father didn't believe me but I KNEW IT! How did you escape?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went underground and they--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they drag you down to their hideous caves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs backs up as Winnie advances, intensely presses him f information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were there mountains of baby bones and rivers of blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they eat your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they let you watch?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, make you watch?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs him by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TELL ME EVERYTHING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaked out and frustrated, Eggs BITES HER ON THE ARM. Sh freezes. They stare at each other, Eggs panting, her in shock. She looks down at her arm flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find the Men in Red Hats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie looks at the bite mark again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bit me with your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Men in Red Hats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boxtroll exterminators? They live down on Curd's Way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie points to the Milk Street sign that they are stand under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curds Way? Milk turns into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one man band drops a CYMBAL: BA DUM CHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs turns to go, then hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't eat babies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? What do you mean we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs rounds a corner and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here! TELL ME EVERYTHING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Fish's frightened face peeking out from under hi box lid. REVEAL he's in a cage, being stared at by the th Redhats -- Pickles, Trout and Gristle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gristle reaches up and pokes him with a cricket bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever wonder what they're thinkin' `bout, Mr. Trout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine they're evaluating their life choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Wonderin' why they chose to be evil, disgusting monsters instead of good guys like us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, Mr. Pickles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see Snatcher, coming down a long walkway beh them, backlit by tall windows. He finishes drying his fac with a towel, then walks towards them, orating THEATRICAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boxtroll cannot CHOOSE a new life because a boxtroll does not ASPIRE to be anything more than a weak, lowly pest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a man -- a great man! (tosses towel, arms wide) And his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleagues?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best chums?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... stooges

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... can choose to change their lives. Our dreams are in our grasp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher lifts Mr. Gristle into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us be dream-graspers, fate- snatchers, destiny-takers! Let us grasp our dreams and shove them down everyone's throat! Am I not right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatcher throws Gristle and Pickles catches him in his ar holding him like a small child. Gristle smiles maniacally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why your name is the boss, boss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'mnotastooge, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pickles releases Gristle as they follow Snatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
